Not obvious how to switch between windows when "New window" is selected in the menu. App relies on android's task switcher (or a 3rd party switcher app) to navigate to previous "window" as if it's a previous app... this should be documented. (I set double touch of the power button's fingerprint sensor to switch to previous app, using Settings | System | Gestures.) My earlier 4 star review was deleted ... NOT COOL!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The system task-swticher is the standard way to switch between tasks (which is also how apps like Google Docs work for different docs). I as the app developer can't delete user reviews - maybe somehow got flagged by Play?

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Although this app doesn't support multi-panel, you can use the "New window" action in menu to achieve multi-window. You can also use the "Open with" option in the per-file menu to open a file with an app of your choice.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Naming it "Material Files" in launcher will make it appear as "Material..." for most users so unfortunately I have to pick a shorter name. The information density issue is a result of following Material Design and it may look much better on a larger screen. Not sure about USB HD though, as this is just a side project of mine and I don't have one üòÇ

Very well done on the app but a small doubt. Why does the app grant networking and sensor permissions by default? Edit :Alright thanks for the info. Regarding the sensors, I've reinstalled the app just to double confirm and its still allowed. I mean it's not a bother since I can disable it but it could be troublesome for other users.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Network is for FTP, SMB and crash reporting etc. I googled for "android.permission.OTHER_SENSORS" and it seems to be a permission only added by a custom ROM and doesn't exist on standard Android at all, nor did this app ever request it. I guess something is off with the ROM's modification. Thanks for helping confirm this and the 5 stars!

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thanks for feedback! I'd love to support Termux and other terminal apps, but they currently¬†doesn't expose anything¬†for implementing this. Currently the only one terminal app that supports specifying a start path is Jackpal's Android Emulator app.
